intro: Schoenoplectiella rogersii, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulrush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in the western United States. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, forming dense stands that help stabilize shorelines. Its slender, grass-like leaves are arranged in tufts, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Schoenoplectiella rogersii plays an important role in wetland ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
